newsitem.title: USA: Sedona, Oracle in data-management deal.
newsitem.headline: Sedona, Oracle in data-management deal.

text.p: Sedona GeoServices Inc, a unit of Scangraphics Inc, said Thursday it had an agreement with Oracle Corp to provide open-standard, data-management capabilities to the geographic information systems (GIS) market.
"Sedona and Oracle will combine their respective technologies to create an open-systems data environment for the GIS market," a Sedona spokesman said.
The alliance marks the first step in a long-term partnership that could lead to joint development of technology, the spokesman said.

Sedona said in a statement it hoped to use this new resource to "develop the next generation of open-client geoprocessing application and data management software to utilize Oracle's Universal Server technology."
One goal was to have Sedona's technology sold under the Sedona label as part of an Oracle data-management package, the spokesman said.
He declined to comment on the estimated financial value of the alliance.
Sedona GeoServices develops GIS database-management software, scanning and image-processing technology, large document scanners, backfile conversion services and imaging software and systems.
